intro: Lasiosiphon madagascariensis var. mandrarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar corymbia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy corymbs of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
